mxCell.value: Ok, done!

<<Accounts>>

Let's spice things up ðŸŒ¶ and give your budget a name! 

You can create as many budgets as you'd like but let's hammer out this first one first. 

When choosing a name, think of something that gets you EXCITED about this whole budgeting shindig but also include the current month and year. 

Here's an example: Rich Life 11/24

Select "My finances" and select "rename budget" to update the name.
highlight: budget_name

<<Accounts>>

Loooove it! ðŸ’ƒðŸ¼

 Now, let's start to add accounts.
Account Setup Process

<<Accounts>>

Now click "Create Local Account". Name your account, select a Type of 'For Budget: Checking' and then enter the current balance of that account.

<<Accounts>>

Ready? Select + Add Account!

<<Accounts>>

For this step, you'll need to log into your bank and see the current balance. Come back to me when you've got that information!
highlight: add_account
Budget Summary Overview

YOU'RE DOING IT! 

 Please click on the Budget button.

<<Budget>>

I'll give you a tour of your budget screen. Here you can see the current month as well as previous and future months.
I clicked them!

<<Budget>>

Let's say you want to compare several months at once. Depending on your browser zoom level, you can select up to six months at a time. Please click the third calendar icon.
highlight: calendar_icons

<<Budget>>

Now you can view three months. Let's change the view so you can see a different set of months using the purple selection.
highlight: months_band

<<Budget>>

Below the current month, there are several pieces of information and an amount labeled "To Budget."
highlight: budget_header

<<Budget>>

While you're getting to know MyBudgetCoach, just focus on the amount to budget for now.

<<Budget>>

Click on the purple number to see some options for this amount. There are multiple ways to move money around your budget. After all, it's meant to be flexible!

<<Budget>>

Let's move onto the next part! ðŸ’ƒðŸ¼
Budget Table Overview

<<Budget>>

This is the budget table, basically a digital cash envelope system! You create categories relevant to your life and budget dollars accordingly.

<<Budget>>

The Category column houses the names of each category. We'll get customizing these in a bit.

<<Budget>>

The Budgeted column is where you'll be budgeting your dollars. This shows you what you have allocated each month for the categories.

<<Budget>>

Next up is the Spent column. This shows you what you've actually spent out of the budgeted dollars.

<<Budget>>

The last column is Balance. This shows you what you have available to spend. If it's negative and red, #oops you've overspent in this category. ðŸ˜° If the amount is black, that's what you have available. ðŸ¤‘

<<Budget>>

If you don't cover this overspending, you either risk over-drafting your checking account or adding debt to your credit card. 
ðŸš©ðŸš©ðŸš©
This is what we are trying to avoid!

<<Budget>>

To the left of the header 'Category' at the top of the Budget Table, select the three dots. This gives you visual options. You can show and hide hidden categories and collapse or expand Category Groups.

<<Budget>>

When you hover over a row, an arrow appears. The rows that have bold text are called 'Category Groups.' The arrow in a Category Group row has options to add a category in this group, hide it, rename it or delete it.

<<Budget>>

Now, add a category to this group. Choose a regular monthly bill you pay, such as your cell phone.

âœ¨Hintâœ¨
Hover over Usual Expenses to reveal the downward arrow.

<<Budget>>

LET'S GO! ðŸ’ƒðŸ¼ 

You're doing this!
Add Transaction

<<Accounts>>

For checking account transactions, payments DECREASE the balance and deposits INCREASE the balance.
Done âœ”ï¸

<<Accounts>>

Click "+ Add New" and select today's date.
highlight: add_new_button
Category added! ðŸš€

<<Accounts>>

For the category, select "Bills."

This part is where you are categorizing the expense in your budget!

<<Accounts>>

You're almost there! 

Finish this transaction by selecting the check mark to turn it green.

<<Accounts>>

Notice the account balance is $100 less?

This is because you just entered in an expense that was $100.
highlight: account_balance
Got it! âœ”ï¸

<<Accounts>>

Let's delete this fake transaction.

 Go ahead and hover on the left side of the date to un-hide a box. Select the box to select the transaction.

<<Accounts>>

WOW! ðŸ’ƒðŸ¼ Let's go!! 

How are you feeling!? You're doing such a great job here.

<<Accounts>>

To the right hand side of the search box, select the purple text with '1 transaction' to see a series of options.

Select 'Delete' to remove that transaction.

If at any point you find that you are needing a bit more support and you would like a 1:1 coaching session. Please note that 1:1 coaching has an additional hourly fee, in addition to your MyBudgetCoach subscription.
highlight: zoom_link
I'm ready!

<<Accounts>>


Let's take the first step to working toward financial empowerment. Together we will walk through the following:

1. Account Tour & Setup
2. How to Add Transactions 
3. Budget Tour & Setup
4. Budget Skills

Database - can keep responses and reference later on; not all questions need the database capture. The second line of the response selected is the database code. If not planning to reference answer later or drive flow based on response in another section, don't need second line.

<<Accounts>> / <<Budget>>

This aligns the avatar with which screen the user should be on. If a user goes to the Budget at a step where the avatar flow has <<Accounts>>, or if the user goes to an Account while the avatar is on Budget, the user will see the following message:

 Please navigate to the Accounts {Budget} to continue our conversation (please select an account).

Please Note: There needs to be a blank line between the reference to Accounts/Budget and the text shown in the avatar window.
...one last thing before I leave you to your budgeting...
Of course
Can you answer 3 short questions for me? I want to make sure I continue to improve how helpful I am!
I submitted the form!
Great! Here's the link: https://airtable.com/appYAaDkGzB3ecOzl/shrUnpE9sHBWWDMyB
Thanks so much! Happy budgeting! ðŸ¤‘
User Survey after Tutorial
There can be a learning curve but remember that I am here to help!
You can book a call with me at any time using the purple "Schedule Video Call" button. You don't have to do this alone. I'd love to help you reach your goals.
Link to giphy: https://giphy.com/gifs/cbc-schittscreek-schitts-creek-3h4Bo5fja4ZgYS0WEg
Let's do this!
Let's do this! ðŸš€

Heyyy, [[user_first_name]]! ðŸ‘‹ I'm Haley!

I LOVE all things budgeting and I am stoked that you selected me as your personal budgeting coach! ðŸ¥³ 

Happy budgeting!
Budget Setup

You as the Coach can do as much or as little as you would like for the user. For example, if you just want to add a handful of categories, or walk them through how to edit and add themselves, that is fine. Alternatively, you could have the system build an entire budget with defined groups, and categories, so when they select the button before the template is built, it automatically updates.

Some coaches have built the table in phases, others offer the option of just groups, and the user adds categories, or the user adds everything. Full discretion to the coach!

<<Budget>>

Shazam! Now THAT is how we break things down. We are getting reallllllllly specific here.
I'm ready!

<<Budget>>

I have something special for you! I am going to set up your budget categories for you. Are you ready for this?

<<Budget>>

Wrap-up setup

<<Budget>>

If you want to move money around, there are a few ways to do this. 

1. Select the To Budget number
2. Enter amount into Budgeted column
3. Select amount in Balance and choose Transfer to another category

All three will get you the same result!
Got it!

<<Budget>>

When the "To Budget" number is zero, that means that every dollar has been assigned. This is the end goal! 

However, if starting in middle of month or end of month, you will want to make sure you do not budget for dollars you've already spent. For example, don't budget your entire month of groceries if you only have 10 days left in the month.

<<Budget>>

The balance column is essentially what you have left to spend for that specific category. 

If you've overspent in a category, this number will turn red. This means you will need to reallocate some funds from other categories to make up for this.
Ooh okay, I see!
Don't Edit - Keep link and keep text
This is the end of the introduction conversation. A user can reset the conversation under the Manage Coach section.

<<Accounts>>

Are you budgeting with a partner?

YES
partner = yes

NO
partner = no

<<Accounts>>

Okay, perfect.

Next
partner_name = [user_input]

<<Accounts>>

Okay, great! What is your partner's name?

<<Accounts>>

Thanks for sharing! This is super helpful info. I look forward to working with you and [[partner_name]] throughout the tutorial!

<<Accounts>>

Great job! Let's move on to adding a transaction.

Buttons default to 'Next' if no text is added on line. Button text can be short, or long (even two sentences) and include emojis. If have multiple lines due to a question, can program button text for each line.
Consider having a question to create a break for the user. Could also reference the earlier list of steps to complete, and show progress by crossing out those pieces that are done.

<<Accounts>>

There are just a few more functions to point out on the Account screen while we are here.

<<Accounts>>

The 'Import' button allows you to upload an export of transactions from your bank. 

This part is pretty cool!
highlight: import_button
Oh, this is cool! â˜•ï¸

<<Accounts>>

The 'Filter' button allows you to filter down the transactions you are viewing by certain criteria (date, payee, category...). 

Let's say you want to see how much you specifically spent at your favorite coffee shop so far, you can search the name of the coffee shop under "payee" and magically your coffee shop spending will all be in one place!
highlight: filter_button

<<Accounts>>

The 'Undo' and 'Redo' buttons are helpful tools when you are working in this screen.

Please note: These are also available in the Budget screen as well. However, when selected, they will 'Undo' or 'Redo' your last action completed for either Accounts or Budget, depending on where your last action was.

<<Accounts>>

This is the 'Search' bar. As you type, whether text or numbers, the list of transactions will dynamically filter down based on criteria entered.
highlight: search_bar

<<Accounts>>

This is the 'Split/Toggle' button. If you happen to have split transactions, this button will expand or collapse those transactions from view.
highlight: split_toggle_button

<<Accounts>>

These three dots show additional options.

<<Accounts>>

1. Show running balance
2. Hide 'cleared' checkboxes
3. Export
4. Reconcile
5. Link account
6. Close account
highlight: more_button
Coach can decide how much explanation they want to provide for each of these. Reconciliation for example can be a complex discussion.

<<Accounts>>

Type "Cell Phone Company" as your Payee.

This is essentially the vendor or where your transaction came from.
highlight: select_payee
highlight: select_category

<<Accounts>>

Now, how much was the expense? 

For this example, enter $100 in the Payment box.
highlight: payment_input
Got it!

<<Accounts>>

Now click "Add". 

Please note, you can select "Cancel" to get out of adding transactions.
highlight: cleared_status_icon
Boom, baby! ðŸ’¥
highlight: save_transaction
highlight: months_band
highlight: budget_table
highlight: category_column
highlight: budgeted_column
highlight: spent_column
highlight: balance_column
Done! âœ”ï¸

<<Budget>>

The rows below a Category Group row, without bold text, are called Categories. When you hover over a Category row, the arrow that appears gives you the option to Hide, Rename, and Delete that Category.

<<Budget>>

Below the categories is the 'Income' Section.

<<Budget>>

The Income row is generally the total amount of deposits to a checking or savings account in a month. 

The Starting Balances row is calculated your first month, but then remains $0 each month after that. You can 'Hide' this category if you choose after your first month.
highlight: received_column

<<Budget>>

Also when you hover on a Category row, a small paper icon appears. Selecting this opens up a note box. This can be used to capture helpful information about that category. 

For example, the amount you intend to budget each month, or when it is due, if not due monthly.
Got it!

<<Budget>>

When you hover over the month at the top of the budget summary, two up arrows are shown to the left. Selecting this will collapse the budget summary view to only show the 'To Budget' amount.

You can expand by hovering over the month and then selecting the two now down arrows to the left of the month.

<<Budget>>

To the right of the month there are three vertical dots. Selecting this shows additional options that can have dollars budgeted to all your categories in one click.

<<Budget>>

These options include:

1. Copy last month's budget
2. Set budgets to zero
3. Set budgets to 3 month average
highlight: budget_more_button

All boxes don't need to have <<Accounts>> or <<Budget>>. If you remove this, that means the user can be in either screen and the avatar will continue. This can help with transitions from one section to another.

<<Budget>>

Let's move now to how to go about budgeting your dollars and how to give every dollar a job!

<<Budget>>

Nice work! ðŸ’ƒðŸ¼You're that much closer to being a budget pro!
This section could be very extensive, or you could keep it high level and create a separate conversation the next time the user gets paid.
highlight: selected_transactions_button

Order of Walk-Through

Can organize your conversation to have Budget table overview first (no numbers so simpler with less questions) then Accounts OR you could have Accounts first and then have Budget Table.
For Link Account, consider offering a launch to the Import Transaction Options conversation.
HelpScout Articles: Footer of MyBudgetCoach.com; Company; Knowledge Base
Budget Skills
Credit Cards get added in a separate conversation. For the Intro, just focus on Checking account. Feel free to let your user know Credit Cards can be added later on in a separate conversation.

First things first! I am not the REAL Haley... 

I am the Haley who can be in all places at all times and I'm here to help you throughout your MyBudgetCoach experience! ðŸ’°

The real Haley is probably chasing her 3 kids around, recording a podcast or working out some tweaks in a spreadsheet formula. 

I'm here to help you with any questions that you have because my main goal is to get you to fall in love with budgeting! ðŸ’œ

You are in for a treat! 

We are going to learn budgeting from an entirely different lens... one that allows YOU to be in control of YOUR money! 

We can even add in a line item for your weekly avocado toast order ðŸ¥‘
I am going to guide you through a setup tutorial which will show you some important aspects of MyBudgetCoach.

If you want to review a step again, select the 'Back' button below. If you want to hide the avatar conversation because my face is in the way of you seeing your money, select the 'x' at the top left of my picture. You can continue the conversation by selecting the 'Introduction' conversation in the left side menu bar above the 'Schedule Video Call' button.

In the bottom right window of an open conversation, there are three vertical dots. This will give you the option to: 

1. Give feedback 
2. Reset this conversation
3. End this conversation

Let's get started with personalizing your budget so it works for you. 

But first things first, I have some questions.

If you have any questions, you can always send me messages at any time by using the "Messages" button found on the left-hand menu. I will reply within one business day. 

In addition to any messages we have back and forth, as you complete conversations your progress and sections will be shown within "Messages" in a chat format.
